column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4. Discussions

#Text=Each study concerning crop species prediction with multi-temporal SAR data has some unique features , including the classification approach , number , and specificity of crop species used , as well as the SAR data used .
#Text=This generally complicates comparison , as no baseline mapping approach is established , often requiring testing with several approaches within each study , e.g. , .
#Text=Other factors affecting the possible accuracy levels in mapping are the structure of the crop species , that is , whether only crop species are predicted or also root vegetables .
#Text=In this study , different types of species groups were predicted with high accuracy .
#Text=Uncertainty levels of the prediction were also assessed .
#Text=Achieved accuracy levels compare favourably to prior recent studies particularly with multitemporal Sentinel-1 data .
#Text=Here , OA was either at same level or higher , especially when using the parcel size threshold of four hectares .
#Text=Importantly , the number of crops was considerably higher , indicating a potential for further development of an operational crop mapping method .

#Text=The overall accuracy ( OA ) with the ik-NN method varied depending on the number of species included in the classification , and whether all field parcels were included , or an area threshold for the field parcels was employed .
#Text=The later one exhibits the dependence of OA on the size of the area threshold .
#Text=The OAs have been calculated here using the observation as the weight , that is , each field parcel had the same weight .
#Text=The area weighted OAs had been larger because the crop species were predicted more accurately for the larger field parcels than for the small field parcels .
#Text=Some tests with a very high number of the species groups showed also a great OA .
#Text=The OA was at a level of 82 % with 41 species and with an area threshold of 0.5 hectares .
#Text=However , the results with 41 species groups are dominated by a few species with large areas explaining an unexpected large OA .
#Text=The uncertainty assessments of the predicted crop species also gave promising results .
#Text=The certainty was over 90 % in most cases when using 95 % confidence intervals ( Table 7 and Table 8 , see also
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=) .

#Text=The prediction uncertainty is largest in the rare species groups , such as 2 , 4 , and 7 ( Broad bean Vicia faba , Spring Oilseed Rape and 7 = Winter wheat , Winter barley ) as can be expected .
#Text=Overall , the species can be predicted relatively accurately in most cases , even compared to the earlier studies .
#Text=Importantly , while SAR time series have been used recently , the analyses of the effect of the precise acquisition time of the SAR data in crop species predictions has been studied less .
#Text=The scenes from the late growing season had the greatest explanatory power in predicting the crop species (
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=and
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=) .

#Text=The analyses separately with the VV and VH polarizations and with one Sentinel-1 scene only revealed the same thing ; in addition to that , the VV polarization gave greater OAs than VH polarization in the later part of the growing season (
#Text=Figure 8
#Text=) .
#Text=Establishing the number of Sentinel-1 scenes and the timing of SAR data that it takes to achieve acceptable overall accuracy can have important effects on operational LPIS .
#Text=The time period from which the Sentinel-1 scenes or other SAR data are needed depends naturally on the progress of the growing season and thus the latitude and other growing factors .
#Text=The data acquisition period must be adapted to the local conditions .
#Text=The proposed method to estimate the confidence intervals of the probabilities of the predicted species group is also new to the best of our knowledge .
